meanings.definition: Belief in or expectation of an imminent end of the world.
meanings.sent1: Her apocalypticism led her to prepare for the end times by stocking up on supplies.
meanings.sent2: The preacher's apocalypticism resonated with those who feared the world's demise.
meanings.sent3: Despite his apocalypticism, he still found time to enjoy the simple pleasures of life.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, apocalypticism painted a vivid picture of a world in chaos.
meanings.sent5: The apocalypticism in the movie made the audience ponder the fragility of existence.

meanings.definition: A worldview or belief system centered around cataclysmic events and divine intervention.
meanings.sent1: Their apocalypticism shaped their decisions, always considering the possibility of divine intervention.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization's apocalypticism influenced their rituals and traditions.
meanings.sent3: Despite the storm, his apocalypticism remained unwavering, believing in a higher power's protection.
meanings.sent4: The novel's apocalypticism added a layer of suspense and mystery to the plot.
meanings.sent5: The apocalypticism of the tribe guided their interactions with the natural world.

meanings.definition: The study or interpretation of apocalyptic literature.
meanings.sent1: His fascination with apocalypticism led him to pursue a degree in religious studies.
meanings.sent2: Scholars gathered to discuss the nuances of apocalypticism in ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: The professor's class on apocalypticism was both enlightening and engaging.
meanings.sent4: The conference focused on the history and impact of apocalypticism in various cultures.
meanings.sent5: Her research on apocalypticism shed light on its significance in religious contexts.
